intro: Lasiosiphon similis, commonly known as the New Zealand morning glory, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its twining stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has adapted to the temperate climate of its native habitat. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range in color from white to pink. Lasiosiphon similis is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
